titles.title: To direct the Administrator of General Services, on behalf of the Archivist of the United States, to convey certain Federal property located in the State of Alaska to the Municipality of Anchorage, Alaska.

To direct the Administrator of General Services, on behalf of the Archivist of the United States, to convey certain Federal property located in the State of Alaska to the Municipality of Anchorage, Alaska.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. H. Rept. 113-407.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 299.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3786.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on April 9, 2014. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Directs the Administrator of the General Services Administration (GSA), on behalf of the Archivist of the United States, to convey to the City of Anchorage, Alaska, property in such city consisting of approximately nine acres and improvements located at 400 East Fortieth Street for not less than fair market value. Makes the net proceeds from such conveyance available to the Archivist to fund repairs and restorations conducted by the National Achives and Records Administration (NARA).
